data.title: Rome: 6-hour bike tour to the Appian Way and Aqueducts Park
data.description: Buy your 6-hour bike tour in Rome to the Appian Way and Aqueducts Park with Musement and discover extraordinary activities in Rome!
data.about:
Treat yourself to an unforgettable 6-hour bike ride, accompanied by an experienced guide, and discover a fascinating area of Rome filled with ancient monuments and natural beauty. Your guide will be waiting a few meters from the Colosseum; then you can reach the Baths of Caracalla and past the Aurelian Walls. You will continue to the countryside to the historical Via Appia Antica. Do not miss this unique opportunity to admire the Tomb of Cecilia Metella and reach the Aqueduct Parkwhere you can appreciate the incredible works built by the Romans.The tour includes the following stops:
- Baths of Caracalla
- Porta S. Sebastiano and Aurelian Walls
- Via Appia Antica
- Catacombs of St. Callisto
- Circus of Maxentius
- Tomb of Cecilia Metella
- Ninfeo of the Villa dei Quintili
- Aqueduct Park
- Nymphaeum of Egeria
- Caffarella Park
data.meeting_point: Office WHEELY - Via Labicana, 118 - 00184 RomePlease arrive at least 15 minutes before the tour
not_included: Access ticket to monuments and museums

data.title: 4-hour evening bike tour: ghosts and talking statues of Rome
data.description: Buy your Evening Bike Tour Ghosts and Talking Statues of Rome with Musement. Discover amazing activities in Rome with Musement!
data.about:
Beside its thousand-years old Imperial history, Rome hides a folkloristic and “magic” side made of legends, folk tales and superstitions. For this reason there are many rumors about ghosts and spirits of the ones who died in the many bloody deeds that were so frequent in Roman history.If we listen to the story-telling of the oldest and most superstitious inhabitants, we can find out that many of these ghosts still haunt the places where they lived or died.Let’s discover the secrets of Castel Sant’Angelo, where Beatrice Cenci was beheaded: according to the legend, her ghost still roams upon its bridge.You will proceed to Piazza del Popolo, where once was a deconsecrated cemetery.Beware the ghost of Olimpia Pamphili, that uses to run across Piazza Navona with her chariot towed by black horses! Let yourself charm by the unreal atmosphere of Piazza di Spagna, haunted by the ghost of the English poet John Keats, or by the ghost of Emperor Nero and the ones of the wild beasts in the Coliseum…Just like the countless legends of Rome’s ghosts, folk-tales and stories hung upon the so-called “talking statues” have many things to tell. In the past several statues situated in the alleys of the Eternal City where used to hang satirical poems attacking the power of popes and emperors. For this reason, they were called “talking statues”, as they often gave origin to distant dialogues, the “pasquinate”. Pasquino is the most famous talking statue in Rome, but in this tour you will discover many others of them!The tour includes stops at:
- Colosseo
- Foro Romano
- Campidoglio
- Statua di Marforio
- Statua di Lucrezia
- Piazza di Spagna
- Statua del Babuino
- Piazza del Popolo
- Via del Corso
- Statua del Facchino
- Pantheon
- Piazza Navona
- Piazza di Pasquino e Sant’Andrea della Valle
- Statua dell'Abate Luigi
- Campo de' Fiori
- Ponte Sant’Angelo e Castel Sant’Angelo
- Portico d’Ottavia
data.meeting_point: Via Labicana, 118 - Rome (a few meters from the Colosseum)
highlights: Cycle in Piazza di Spagna, haunted by the ghost of English poet John Keats
Enjoy a delicious dinner with Italian spaghetti and wine
Learn about the ghosts of Beatrice Cenci and Olimpia Pamphili
Walk the alleys and hear what Rome's talking statues will tell you
included: Italian spaghetti and wine or an aperitif served near the Colosseum with a great view, according to the period of the year
Free bike seat for infants 0-4 years old

data.title: Rome night walking tour
data.description: Get all the best information for your Night Walking Tour of Rome. Book your tickets and plan your tour in Rome, Italy.
data.about: Discover the magic atmosphere of a night in Rome! This three-hour adventure will cover the most important sights of the Italian capital, along with an expert guide: Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Capitoline Hill and the Colosseum (exterior visit only).This tour includes an overview of the entire Forum area, including the Imperial Forums. The night tour offers an incredible opportunity to experience the romance of Rome at sunset and it is a wonderful way to witness the beauty of the Eternal city lit up by night. Your tour guide is a professional that will be both skilled and knowledgeable.Important: The entrance tickets to the Colosseum and Roman Forum are not included.
data.meeting_point: Outside metro station Colosseo - B line, behind the green newsstand.
highlights: See the famous Piazza Navona and the world-known Fontana di Trevi in the moonlight
A panoramic walking tour of Rome to discover all its magic
Admire the mighty Colosseum at night (exterior visit only)
not_included: Entrance tickets to the Colosseum and Roman Forum

data.title: Rome: 3-hour bike tour
data.description: Buy your "Rome by bicycle 3-hour tour" with Musement and discover other extraordinary activities in Rome.
data.about:
Enjoy a three-hour ride on a comfortable bike in Rome's historical city centre with its breathtaking landscapes, historical monuments and works of art, accompanied by expert guides!Meet your guide a few steps from the Colosseum,the ideal starting point for tourists to discover the Eternal City. Move then to the lively Piazza Venezia crossing the Fori Imperiali. Admire the Trevi fountain and continue to Piazza di Spagna and Piazza del Popolo, reaching the shopping street: Via del Corso.After crossing Campo de 'Fiori,the historic fruit and vegetable market, and the Tiber river , you'll reach Trastevere, a typical Roman neighborhood. Going back to the Colosseum, you'll have the chance to appreciate the Jewish Ghetto and the Theatre of Marcellus.The tour includes the following stops:
- Colosseum
- Fori Imperiali
- Piazza Venezia
- Trevi fountain
- Piazza di Spagna
- Piazza del Popolo
- Via del Corso and Montecitorio
- The Pantheon
- Piazza Navona
- Campo de 'Fiori
- Trastevere
- Isola Tiberina
- The Jewish Ghetto
- The Theatre of Marcellus
data.meeting_point: Office WHEELY - Via Labicana 118 - 00184 RomePlease arrive at least 15 minutes before the tour
highlights: Admire the beauty of the Eternal City walking by bycicle
Discover the hidden corners of Rome with an expert guide
not_included: Entrance fees to monuments and museums

data.title: Rome bike rental: one and two days
data.description: Book your Rome Bike Rental for one or two days with Musement. Plan and buy your extraordinary activities in Rome.
data.about: Rent your bike for a whole day and discover the main monuments and landmarks of Rome, with the complete freedom to see and do exactly what you want!Too big to be explored by foot, and too beautiful and precious to be hastily visited on a motor vehicle, the bicycle is the best way to appreciate the wonders of the Eternal City.You can rent your bike a few meters from the Colosseum, the ideal starting point for tourists who want to discover Rome. Wheely's bikes are designed to ride on saddles in a comfortable riding position which allows us to appreciate the urban landscape; They are equipped with front suspension and larger tires for the comfort and safety on cobblestones, on the uneven terrain of city villas and Appia Antica.
not_included: Anything that is not listed as included

data.title: Authentic Rome: Jewish Ghetto & Trastevere Walking Tour
data.description: Get all the best information for your Jewish Ghetto & Trastevere Walking Tour. Book your tickets, skipping the line, at official rates. Get informed, plan and book your tour in Rome, Italy.
data.about: Discover the real Rome during this three-hour walking tour. After seeing the most famous attractions, like the Colosseum and the Vatican, take a break from the crowds, escape the traffic and explore the backstreets of the historic center that most tourists do not even know exist.Take a leisurely stroll through the Jewish Ghetto and Trastevere area, starting from Largo Argentina and the Senate House where Julius Caesar was murdered. You’ll then continue across Tiber Island to Campo de' Fiori, once a site of executions during the Inquisition, today one of the city's most lively piazzas.On this tour you will get a chance to see the hidden ancient city below the modern street level and a little bit of every time period in between, from Medieval times, the Renaissance to the Baroque era. Your expert guide will entertain you with the legends and secrets of Rome's most authentic neighborhoods.
data.meeting_point: The tour meets where Largo di Torre Argentina joins via dei Cestari, on the northern side of Largo di Torre Argentina, between the newsstand and the shop "Sermoneta".
highlights: Largo di Torre Argentina
Piazza Mattei
Portico d'Ottavia
The Synagogue (exterior visit)
Tiber Island
Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere
Piazza Farnese
Campo de' Fiori

data.title: Audio guided tour of the Pantheon in Rome (Basilica of St. Mary and the Martyrs)
data.description: Visit the Pantheon (Basilica of St. Mary and the Martyrs) and admire this beautiful ancient Roman building with an audioguide in your language.
data.about: Visit the Basilica of Santa Maria ad Martyres, better known as the Pantheon, and admire the beauty of this ancient Roman structure. With the help of an audio guide in your own language, unravel the history and mysteries of this monument, the only ancient Roman building that has remained almost intact today.Originally a temple consecrated to all the gods, and later converted into a Christian Basilica, the building was initially commissioned by Marco Agrippa and built by Emperor Hadrian between 120 and 124 A.D., following the fires that had damaged the structure. Before finishing your audio guide tour, don't forget to look towards the sky and admire the oculus - a circular opening in the dome which lights up the entire building.
data.meeting_point: Audio guide desk of the Pantheon (Basilica of St. Mary and the Martyrs)
highlights: Discover the history and mysteries of the Pantheon with your audio guide
Admire the beauty and harmony of this architectural structure
Admire the open oculus at the centre of the great dome
included: Audio guide in your language to explore the Pantheon on your own, with complete autonomy

data.title: Tickets for Villa dei Quintili and the tomb of Cecilia Metella
data.description: Buy your tickets for Villa dei Quintili: discover the vast monumental complex in the Roman countryside and visit an ancient imperial estate.
data.about: The Villa dei Quintili is the largest residential complex in the suburb of Rome. Having become the property of the State since 1986, the original nucleus belonged to the Quintili consuls brothers (151 AD) and subsequently transformed into imperial property under the emperor Commodus. The Villa, built around a large square, extends between the Appia Antica and the Via Appia Nuova. The monumental complex, with thermal rooms, calidarium and frigidarium, overlooks terraces on the Roman countryside. Inside the structure, you can still admire the wealth of sculptural decorations, floors and walls in colored marble.
highlights: Visit what was once an ancient imperial property
Discover the vast monumental complex in the Roman countryside
Admire sculptural remains and colorful wall decorations

data.title: Piazza Navona underground - Stadium of Domitian entrance tickets and walking tour
data.description: Don't miss the chance to visit the Stadium of Domitian, the first and only known example of a masonry stadium in Rome, located beneath the charming Navona Square!
data.about:
The remains of the Stadium of Domitian (UNESCO World Heritage) are located beneath Piazza Navona, about 5 meters below ground. This archaeological area is what remains of the first and only masonry stadium known of in Roman history.The Stadium of Domitian was commissioned by Emperor Titus around 80 AD (the same year the Coliseum was completed). Today, this Stadium, once home to Roman entertainment, lies underneath a modern city. It is certainly worth a visit to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.Depending on your needs you can choose between two different ticket options.If you want to visit the site at your own pace and enter anytime during the opening hours of the site, without missing the stories behind the Stadium, you can choose the option Entrance + audio guide. The audio guide included in the ticket (for children too), illustrated panels, unpublished photos, and videos (also in 3D) tell the stories of the Stadium, Piazza Navona, sports in ancient Rome, and some of the city's major monuments.If you want to have a more complete experience of the Domitian Stadium and the city of Rome, you can choose the option Entrance + guided tour that includes a 2-hour guided walking tour of Rome's most popular monuments and bustling piazzas. Meet your personal guide at TOURISTATION NAVONA in navona Square. Take a walk through bustling Piazza Navona, perhaps the most beautiful square in Rome with its magnificent fountains, including the famous Fountain of the 4 Rivers by Bernini.The tour includes exclusive entrance at Navona Square underground.
Explore the Pantheon, the temple dedicated to all divinities. This magnificent building is considered the most well-preserved ancient temple in the world. Toss a coin into the Trevi Fountain, the largest and best-known fountain in Rome, to ensure that you will return to Rome one day.The guided tour will end at the Campidoglio and from a fantastic spot, you will be able to have the greatest view of the Roman Forum and the Coliseum at night.
data.meeting_point: For the option Entrance + audioguide please show your voucher at the entrance of the Stadium, located at Via di Tor Sanguigna 3, to access the Stadium of Domitian.For the option Entrance + guided tour meet your guide at the TOURISTATION NAVONA in Navona Square 25.
highlights: Explore Piazza Navona underground, opened to the public for the first time in 2014
Take a glimpse of underground Rome as it was 2000 years ago
Admire the ancient ruins of the first masonry stadium built in Rome
Discover the story of the Stadium, Piazza Navona, and sports in Ancient Rome
Select the option Entrance + guided tour and get the chance to discover Rome with a guide
included: Entrance ticket to the Domitian Stadium (included in both options)
Audioguide tour available in Italian, English, French, Spanish, German, Russian and for kids Italian and English (only with the option Entrance + audioguide)
Expert guide and 2-hour walking tour (only with the option Entrance + guided tour)

data.title: Tickets to the Leonardo Da Vinci Museum: "the genius and his inventions"
data.description: Visit the Leonardo Da Vinci Museum and discover all of Leonardo's incredible inventions. Come and admire his ingenious machines!
data.about: Enter the incredible mind of Leonardo da Vinci, a leading artist and intellectual of the Italian Renaissance. See more than 200 machines and try out 65 working wooden models, created using the famous da Vinci codes. These include flying machines, war machines, mechanisms and water machines. Continue along the path to admire the most important studies on anatomy.Discover the 9 holograms created with the latest holographic technology, which gave life to the inventions of the great Genius. Examines his studies on "Water", "Air", "Fire" and "Earth" to get a more complete picture of his intellect and approach his inventions in the scientific, military and aviation fields.The exhibition is housed in the Palazzo della Cancelleria, owned by the Vatican. The late 15th-century building is one of the most beautiful buildings in Rome, adjacent to the most famous squares, including Campo dei Fiori and Piazza Navona. This building is of great interest because of its impressive Renaissance architecture. The upper floor houses the Vatican court: the Sacra Rota and the Sala dei Cento giorni, entirely frescoed by Vasari.Visiting the Museum, you can also access an underground Rome housing the remains of a burial temple of the consul Aulus Irzio dating back to 43 BCE, immersed in the waters of the ancient Euripus river. This is a truly unique and rare site to admire in Rome.
highlights: Discover some of the incredible inventions of Leonardo Da Vinci
See the ingenious flying machines, from war to water
Examine first hand Da Vinci's studies on anatomy and natural elements

data.title: Guided visit to Mario Merz's “Igloos” show
data.description: Visit the exhibition "Igloos" by Mario Merz, a key figure of Arte Povera. Discover and learn all about more than 30 Igloos in the Pirelli HangarBicocca with a guided visit today.
data.about: A cultural mediator/guide will accompany visitors to discover the exhibition "Igloos", dedicated to Mario Merz (Milan, 1925-2003). Merz is one of the most important post-war artists who brings together the corpus of his most iconic works, his igloos, dating from 1968 to his death. Mario Merz, a key figure of Arte Povera, investigates and represents the processes of the transformation of nature and human life: in particular igloos, visible reminders of primordial houses, become for the artist the archetype of inhabited places and of the world. Igloos come to represent the metaphor of the different relationships between interior and exterior, between physical space and conceptual space, and between individuality and collectivity. This exhibition offers the opportunity to observe works of historical importance and innovative scope, coming from all over from private collections and international museums. Here his works are collected and exhibited together for the first time ever in such large numbers!
highlights: Take the opportunity to observe more than 30 igloos by Mario Merz - works of historical importance and innovative, collected and exhibited together for the first time ever in such large numbers
Discover how the artist, a key figure of Arte Povera, investigates and represents the processes of the transformation of nature and human life
Explore the unusual landscape configured by the igloos that extends into the Navate and Pirelli Cubas HangarBicocca
included: Guided visit to the Mario Merz “Igloos” show

data.title: Torre Branca tickets
data.description: Buy your tickets to visit Torre Branca in Milan. Climb to the city's highest point in Sempione Park and admire the breathtaking skyline.
data.about:
The Tower:
In the 30's, the rising city built its totem in the clearing of 'Parco Sempione'. Designed by Gio Ponti, the tower is considered a true work of art in which modern architecture and new techniques meet. Slim and transparent, a true architectural challenge, it was erected in record time– just two and a half months. It was built in 1933, on the occasion of the 5th Trienniale Exhibition, along with six large isolated, temporary arches designed by Sironi. Milan gets the "European exclusive" of an International Triennial Exhibition of decorative, industrial arts and modern architecture.The intervention of Branca:
Having become unusable, the Tower was decommissioned in 1972. It has been completely restored and made accessible again by Fratelli Branca, a name it began bear in 2002. The technical data:
All in Dalmine pipes, made from a special steel, flanged and bolted, the Tower is 108.60 meters high. The main structure has a pyramidal-trunk shape with a hexagonal section, from a side that reaches six meters to the base. At an altitude of 100 meters, the side of the hexagon it's still 4.45 meters. The very slight taper suggests an almost prismatic appearance. Today, a modern lift system allows entrance to the indoor Belvedere Club– five people at a time, in less than one minute. The idea:
At the base of the renovation work, there was a will to hand over to the city of Milan, a restaurant-bar that could also host events. The Branca wanted to help awaken the pride of Milan with a unique landmark– a symbol of a new, creative and innovative effort, projected into the future. At the base of the tower there is a metal support structure, of semicircular shape, inspired by the elements of the fascinating work of monumental art meant to represent a natural technological evolution. It constitutes an axis of orientation that respects the squareness of the monumental architectures of the park (Palazzo dell' Arte, Castello, Arena and Arco della Pace) and is located at a lower level than the base, to avoid visually interfering with the monument. The beautiful casing and wall, facing the side of the park in high-strength transparent crystal, allow a suggestive perspective view of the Tower from the inside.Private events at Torre Branca:
Torre Branca can be rented by companies and individuals for parties, corporate events and cocktails with panoramic views and exhibitions. For more information you can contact the Musement Customer Care by writing to support@musement.com or by calling 0245386900 Monday to Friday from 8.00am to 7.00pm and Saturday and Sunday from 9.00am to 7.00pm.
highlights: Visit Torre Branca and reach the highest point in Milan at Parco Sempione
Admire Gio Ponti's work of art
Reach the scenic terrace by lift
Milan's skyline awaits you for a dip in the clouds
included: Climb to the lookout deck cabin with elevator

data.title: Tickets for "AgruMI" at Milan's Villa Necchi Campiglio
data.description: Take part in "AgruMI", an exhibition and market dedicated to citrus fruits in the enchanting Villa Necchi Campiglio! Discover innovative ideas and take part in educational workshops.
data.about: Enjoy two days of delightful scents and intense colors, a journey through the stories and secrets of citrus fruit. If you love authentic flavors, if you are always looking for quality products, or if you want to spend a day immersed in art and nature, don's miss out on "AgruMI", the eighth edition of the exhibition and market dedicated to the citrus world.Exhibitors and plant growers from all over Italy will offer the best of their productions: plants, fruits, jams, honeys, mustards, perfumes, jewels and cosmetics. To fill the days, there will be a rich program of initiatives, including educational workshops, meetings with experts and activities for children.The splendid Villa Necchi Campiglio, designed by the great architect Piero Portaluppi in the center of Milan, will be the magnificent setting for this event. A unique opportunity to admire the amazing masterpieces of art displayed in its rooms and take in the refined atmosphere of the Milanese bourgeoisie of the last century.
highlights: Participate in an exhibition and local market dedicated to citrus: plants, fruits and selected citrus products
Discover the innovative ideas of plant growers and exhibitors: workshops, suggestions from experts and activities for children
Visit Villa Necchi Campiglio, a splendid 1930s residence in the heart of Milan
Stroll through the rooms of Villa Necchi Campiglio and admire the works of the great masters of 20th century art, from Picasso to Fontana, from Modigliani to Matisse
included: The "Cumulative" ticket includes admission to the "AgruMI" event + admission and free visit to Villa Necchi Campiglio
"Event only" ticket includes admission to the "AgruMI" event
The special promotion Citrus + Soffio ticket includes admission to the "AgruMI" and "Soffio di primavera" events

data.title: Tickets for 'Soffio di primavera' at Villa Necchi Campiglio in Milan
data.description: Buy tickets to 'Soffio di Primavera' and take part in the exhibition and market dedicated to gardening enthusiasts at Villa Necchi Campiglio.
data.about: The first and most eagerly awaited floriculture event of the season: a two-day exhibition-cum-market with 30 carefully selected nursery gardeners, invited for their specialization and the quality of their work. Categories on show include: annual, biennial and perennial flowering plants; plants and shrubs for gardens and terraces; aromatic plants to add fragrances and flavors to your spring salads; winter vegetable plants; rustic plants for the front door and the backyard; bulbous plants in bloom between late winter and early spring; cacti; furniture, tools and products for maintaining your garden and orchard; collection of acacias; seeds; gardening books; and botanical illustration books.The event will also have a diverse activities program: meetings and book presentations on gardening; practical pruning lessons; the inevitable 'the gardener answers' meeting, and creative workshops with a floral theme for the little ones.The splendid Villa Necchi Campiglio in the heart of Milan, designed by the great architect Piero Portaluppi, will provide the setting for the event. A unique opportunity to admire the stunning artworks displayed in the Villa's rooms and to experience the sophisticated atmosphere of the 20th-century Milanese bourgeoisie.
highlights: Visit the exhibition and market dedicated to greenthumbs and gardening enthusiasts
Breathe in the spring air with plants, flowers and gardening products
Admire Villa Necchi Campiglio, a splendid 1930s villa in the heart of Milan
Stroll through the villa's rooms and admire artworks by the great masters of the 20th century, from Picasso to Fontana, from Magritte to Matisse
included: The 'Combined' ticket includes admission to the 'Un soffio di primavera' event + free visit to Villa Necchi Campiglio
The 'Solo manifestazione' ticket includes admission to the 'Un soffio di primavera' event

data.title: Milano Card for 24, 48 or 72 hours
data.description: Buy your Milano Card with Musement. Visit the best attractions saving money and time!
data.about:
MilanoCard is the official tourist pass of Milan. It offers unlimited access to the Milan public transport, a personal driver for a ride, access to Milan top attractions, and a very interesting range of discounts for museums, tours, resturants, hotel, shops, activities and more. Available for 24h, 48h and 72h, the MilanoCard is the best and cheapest solution to move around the city and make the most for less. Get your digital card and avoid waiting in line to redeem your voucher! Through MilanoCard APP (after activating the card) you will also get an audio guide of the historical center of Milan by clicking on the "Free audioguide in Milan" section.Some of the free opportunites include*:
- free personal Uber driver for 1 ride
- free access to Highline Galleria
- free access to Poldi Pezzoli Museum
- free access to Museo Bagatti Valsecchi
- free access to Torre Branca
- free ticket to Outlet shopping bus for Vicolungo, Franciacorta and Scalo Milano
- free menù at Pizzeria ai 12 Gatti
- Artisinal Panettone (sweet cake)
- Entrance to the AC Milan Museum
- Bus ticket to the Milano Designer District
- Bus ticket to Vicolungo Outlet
- Bus ticket to Franciacorta Outlet Village
 Discounted rates up to 50% for:
- La Scala Theatre Museum
- Triennale Art Design Museum
- Ambrosiana Gallery (Codex Atlanticus of Leonardo da Vinci)
- Diocensa Museum
- Villa Necchi Campiglio
- The Last Supper tour
- Airport bus to Malpensa, Linate and Orio al Serio
- Bus City tour of Milan
...and much much moreUse your MilanoCard also in Venice and Rome to visit the best attractions saving money and time!*Only a limited number of free entries are allowed per day. Not valid for MIlanoCard PerMilano.
highlights: Free public transport for 24, 48 or 72h
Free personal driver
Free access to Milan top attractions
Discounts for museums, tours, restaurants
included: Coupon for free access to Milan top attractions (limited per day)

data.title: Sforza Castle and museums skip-the-line tickets
data.description: Buy your skip-the-line tickets to visit the Sforza Castle in Milan and its museums today to discover and learn all about the history and culture of Milan!
data.about:
The fifteenth-century Sforza Castle was commissioned by Francesco Sforza, the former Duke of Milan. The residence of the city’s lords for four centuries, Sforza Castle was one of the biggest citadels in Europe. Today the castle overlooks Sempione Park, the largest park in the city. Following an extensive restoration work carried out at the beginning of the twentieth century, it now houses several of the city's museums and art collections.This skip-the-line ticket allows the visitor to access the Sforza Castle Museums: 
- Pinacoteca del Castello Sforzesco: saves a rich collection of paintings, including works by Filippo Lippi, Antonello da Messina, Mantegna, Canaletto, Correggio, Tiepolo and the last statue by Michelangelo, the Rondanini Pietà
- Museum of Prehistory 
- Egyptian Museum 
- Museum of Ancient Art 
- Museum of Musical Instruments 
- Museum of Mobile 
- Civic Collections of Applied Art
highlights: Visit the Sforza Castle, one of the great symbols of Milan
Skip the line and get access to the castle's museums
Admire the last statue of Michelangelo: Rondanini Pieta
Discover the lives of the dukes of Milan who lived here
included: Skip-the-line daily ticket to the Sforza Castle and its museums:

from 11.30 pm
YOUTH milan - Space Milan in collaboration with • NO PLAN •
present

wAYF
>> Online Tickets:
Buy your ticket online on Xceed
Save, skip the line and come in whenever you want!
Unity is strength, especially if it gives rise to virtuous synergies. A concept that in Italy is always struggling to take root but that Amnesia Milano has managed to make its own in times not suspicious. The umpteenth try again? The party of Friday, March 1, 2019 which sees the protagonists Youth Milan and Space Milan and which takes advantage of the collaboration of NO PLAN., Three young underground realities always consistent with themselves.
Friday, March 1, the Amnesia Milano console hosts PAWSA, Alex Rubia & Maiki (Youth Milan), Fabio Vi (No Plan.) And Wayf (Space Milan).
The London PAWSA always prefers the facts to words: his favorite slogan is "let the music do the talking", a rule that has always put into practice with its tech house is not foreign to old school recalls, as shown by its mixes Groover Essentials and the release of its Solid Grooves Records label.
Amnesia Milan - via Alfonso Gatto ang. Forlanini - Milan

data.title: Skip-the-line tickets to Leonardo da Vinci Museum in Florence
data.description: Do not miss the Leonardo da Vinci Museum in Florence: get your skip-the-line tickets, see the machines designed by Leonardo and enjoy an unmissable experience!
data.about: This Museum, dedicated to the thought and works of Leonardo da Vinci, is situated in the historical center of Florence, 200 meters from the Cathedral and very close to the Accademia Gallery. Inside, visitors will discover working and interactive reproductions of Leonardo’s machines, created from the famous “Da Vinci Codes”. The exhibition, recommended for children from 7 years old and adults alike, stimulates curiosity and promotes understanding of his remarkable work: it is organized in four sections, “Earth”, “Water”, “Air” and “Fire”. All the machines have been built according to Leonardo da Vinci’s designs and, where possible, to scale. In addition, there is also a section dedicated to some of Leonardo’s anatomical studies and a gallery displaying his most important paintings, faithfully reproduced using high-resolution backlight technology. All exhibits are accompanied by informative descriptions in Italian, English, French, German, Spanish and Russian, and multimedia displays provide further information on Leonardo’s life and works. Visitors can also browse and purchase books and souvenirs from the original and well-stocked museum shop.
highlights: See the machines designed by Leonardo in his famous codes
Learn about Leonardo da Vinci and its great inventions
Get your skip-the-line tickets and enjoy an unmissable experience
included: Informative descriptions in Italian, English, French, German, Spanish and Russian

data.title: Tickets to the Florence Synagogue and the Jewish Museum
data.description: Buy your ticket to the Florence Synagogue and the Jewish Museum and visit one of the most important survivals of the exotic Moorish style in Europe.
data.about: The Great Synagogue of Florence, one of the most important examples of Moorish architecture in Europe, was inaugurated in 1882, a few years after the Emancipation of Italian Jews in 1861, with the proclamation of Italy's unification. Its structure, different from the traditional Florentine architecture of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, has a large dome covered in green copper. The inside is particularly striking - for the richness of the geometric elements in the frescoes, the splendor of the mosaics, and the soft light that filters through the stained-glass windows. An integral part of the visit to the Synagogue is the Jewish Museum, founded in 1981 and expanded in 2007. Spread over two floors, the museum hosts a rich collection of ceremonial Jewish art objects, silverware and fabrics from the ancient synagogues of the Florentine ghetto, and photographic and archival documentation on the history of Florence's Jewish communities. On the second floor you will find objects and furnishings related to the most significant moments of the Jewish life cycle, family rituals, and religious holidays. Moreover, you will be able to visit a projection room dedicated to the memory of the Shoah (Holocaust). There is also a computer area connected to the most important Jewish museums and centers in the world.
data.meeting_point: Synagogue and Hebrew Museum in Florence
highlights: Visit one of the most significant examples of exotic Moorish style in Europe
Explore the interior of the synagogue with its geometric decorations, stained glass windows and mosaics
Admire several ceremonial objects of Jewish art, silver and fabrics on display in the Jewish Museum
included: Entrance to the Hebrew Museum in Florence

data.title: San Marco Museum Tickets
data.description: Get all the best information for San Marco's Museum and book your tickets, skipping the line, at official rates. Get informed, plan, book.
data.about: While visiting Florence you will want to stop by the 13th century Dominican Monastery of San Marco. Founded in 1436 it is today a great tourist attraction for its architectural, artistic, religious and cultural importance in the history of Florence. With this ticket you will save time and energy by skipping the lines, avoiding the hours you could possibly spend waiting for your turn at ticket-offices. With this ticket you will receive entrance to San Marco’s Museum (Museo di San Marco) and have free reign to explore the halls, rooms, corridors, chapels, refectory and cloisters of the structure.San Marco’s Monastery San Marco’s Monastery took the place of a previously existing monastery of another order when Cosimo I de’ Medici influenced the renovation and encouraged the establishment of a Dominican community in Florence. He hired the famous Italian architect Michelozzo to plan the building’s renovation and today it is a great example of early 13th century architecture, with a simple, elegant and functional style that greatly reflects the standards of Renaissance design. The building remained a monastery until 1869 when a great part of the building, following some renovation, was dedicated to the Museum of Ancient Florence and later also to the monographic museum dedicated to Beato Angelico, the artist that painted the many beautiful frescoes within the monastery. San Marco’s Monastery was also declared that year a ‘monument of national importance’.San Marco’s MuseumThe Museum of San Marco maintains much of the atmosphere that once belonged to the Dominican convent. The great attraction of this museum is the architectural and artistic importance of the structure, particularly because of the extensive frescoes that decorate the walls of the monastery buildings. At the time in fact the extent of the decorations was greatly unusual but hoped to be a great educational tool for visitors and worshipers. Featured in the museum today is the collection of the works of Fra Angelico that were brought together at the monastery in the 20th century. Another important section of the museum is dedicated to work by Fra Bartolomeo, while another section is devoted to fragments of sculpture and architecture from buildings of central Florence that were demolished in the 19th century.
highlights: Visit the Dominican monastery of San Marco
Admire the beautiful frescoes by Fra Angelico
included: Priority access to the Museum of San Marco

data.title: Tickets for Boboli Gardens, Porcelain Museum and Bardini Garden
data.description: Visit the Palazzo Pitti Museums in Florence: the splendid Boboli Gardens, the Porcelain Museum, and the Bardini Garden.
data.about:
You don't want to skip the museums in Palazzo Pitti during your stay in Florence. In the old residence of the Medici family, you can visit different museums and gain access to the famous Boboli gardens.The museums included in this ticket are:
- the Porcelain Museum
- the Boboli Gardens
- the Bardini Garden
Palazzo PittiThe Palace was built by the rich Florentine banker Luca Pitti and is a Grand Renaissance building that dates back to 1458. The building is made of a rustic stone that gives it an austere but powerful look that is further reinforced by a series of arch-headed apertures, similar to ancient Roman aqueducts. Cosimo I de Medici’s wife bought the building and had artist and architect Giorgio Vasari enlarge the structure to fit the family’s taste, doubling it in size. Porcelain MuseumFound at the top of the Boboli Gardens in a separate building called the 'Palazzina del Cavaliere', the Porcelain Museum holds the most beautiful work of Porcelain in Europe.Boboli Gardens and Bardini GardenThe Boboli Gardens found behind Palazzo Pitti were the first example of Italian gardens that would later become so popular throughout Europe. Statues, fountains and grottoes are spread across the vast gardens, giving you the feeling that you are in an open-air museum. The nearby Bardini Garden is less famous, but unique and romantic in its arrangement as well.
highlights: Visit Palazzo Pitti and explore its wonderful museums
Experience moments to relax in the Boboli Gardens
Stroll among the garden statues, fountains and caves
Explore the Porcelain Museum and the Bardini Garden

data.title: Tickets for the Bargello National Museum
data.description: Get all the best information for the Bargello Museum and book your tickets, skipping the line, at official rates. Get informed, plan, book.
data.about: The Bargello Museum, found in the city of Florence, is part of the group of museums belonging to the Polo Museale Fiorentino and is an art museum dedicated to the "applied" arts. The Bargello museum is found in Palazzo Bargello in the old city and was built in 1255 to be the seat of the city’s administration.Palazzo BargelloPalazzo Bargello is the name of the building that was designed by architect Lapo Tedesco. The building from administrative offices became home to the city’s police force and so remained from the 16th to the 19th century. It was the center of the city’s justice system and a vast area of the building became the city’s prison. A great part of the Volognana Tower, part of Palazzo Bargello, was where the prisoners were mostly held. Its name is in fact the name of the first prisoner ever to be detained in its dungeons, Geri da Volognana. The tower reaches a good 57 meters and the bell on top was for centuries used to call the city’s men to battle or to announce capital executions. In 1865 the first floor of Palazzo Bargello became a public museum and since then the collection has expanded and value grown exponentially. National Museum of BargelloThe National Museum of Bargello has its collection divided into various halls that each have a chronological theme generally. Each room is dedicated to a certain century and/or artist. Great artists like Michelangelo Carrand and Donatello, Andrea and Giovanni della Robbia have rooms in this museum dedicated to them and within these halls the art is theirs or of artists to them contemporary. From pre-Renaissance art to the 16th century the collection continues with displays of art of the Islamic Collection, of 15th century sculptures, bronze artifacts, paintings and objects from various historical periods made of precious elements and material.
highlights: Visit the Museum of Bargello, with a remarkable collection of sculpture and works of art
Explore Palazzo Bargello, which was the center of the city’s justice system

data.title: Tickets for the Medici Chapels Museum
data.description: Book your entrance tickets for the Museum of Medici Chapels. Admire the treasures of the noble family and visit the Chapel of the Princes and the Lorenese Crypt.
data.about:
The museum of the Medici Chapels is found in the Basilica di San Lorenzo, one of Florence’s biggest and oldest churches. Book your tickets in advance here and ensure your entrance to the Chapels without wasting time at the ticket office. You can skip the line and start your exploration of the Medici tombs and chapels as soon as you arrive. This ticket will give you access to the Sagrestia Nuova (New Sacristy from the 16th century), the Chapel of the Princes, the Lorenese Crypt, and a section of the Treasure of San Lorenzo’s Basilica. With this ticket you can also see temporary exhibitions.Medici ChapelsThe Medici family was one of the most powerful families in the city’s history. The Basilica di San Lorenzo was built thanks to their support and the financial responsibility they took over the construction. The Sagrestia Nuova was designed by Michelangelo in the 16th century and was to be a mausoleum to members of the Medici family. The famous artist also designed many of the tombs that are found in the New Sacristy. More than 50 members of the Medici family have tombs in the New Sacristy and in the Chapel of Princes. Surmounted by a great dome, the Chapel of Princes was a true expression of court art, being the result of the collaboration of artists and lords alike.The Treasure of San Lorenzo’s Basilica and the Cripta LoreneseUntil recently the Treasure of San Lorenzo was carefully preserved behind closed doors but now the underground floors of the Medici chapels have been carefully prepared to have parts of the Basilica’s treasure on display. Special focus is given to some works of art that were recently restored – like the Christ by Michelozzo, a silver statue completed in the year 1444 or the Bust of Saint Peter in wood and painted gold, that dates back to 1552.
The Cripta Lorenese is the crypt of the Lorena family that succeeded the Medici family in the city’s administrative role. They also had their family mausoleum built in the Basilica di San Lorenzo and it found in between the tomb of father Cosimo Patrie and the Medici Sepulcher.
highlights: Admire the treasures of the Medici Chapels Museum
Visit the Chapel of the Princes and the Lorenese Crypt
See the treasure of San Lorenzo’s Basilica
Access to temporary exhibitions
included: A section of the Treasure of San Lorenzo’s Basilica

data.title: Best of Florence self-guided walking tour with audiopen
data.description: Enjoy a self-guided walking tour of Florence with your audiopen: touch all the not-to-be-missed monuments with an independent visit of the city!
data.about: Do not miss this informative tour, the new way to visit Florence in total freedom without wasting of time: take the opportunity to discover Florence in a funny, interactive and independent way! Thanks to an innovative "audiopen", you can explore the old city center at your own pace and in total relax, following the charming itinerary designed for you by expert local guides and through which you can see all the iconic monuments of the city center. You will be so free to dedicate to each point of interest, all the time that you wish, alternating the experience of the visit with all the stops that you want to do!Your audioguide is at your disposal as a "personal guide" for a whole day and you can play back the comments as many times as you like. The use of this magic pen is very easy. Simply passing it on one of the points of interest shown on the map provided with your audioguide, you can listen very clearly the commentary about the monument that you have reached: a great way to discover, one by one, all the not-to-be-missed sights and all the highlights of the "Cradle of the Renaissance". Also, your "audiopen" will provide interesting information about the Renaissance period and the famous and powerful Medici family. During the walking tour you will receive useful information regarding the history of Florence and the Renaissance period, touching all the most important sights of the city, as the Church of San Lorenzo, the Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, the Baptistery of St. John, the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore with the majestic Brunelleschi's Dome, Repubblica Square, the Medieval District with Dante’s House, Strozzi Palace, Tornabuoni Street, Ponte Vecchio, Palazzo Pitti with the Boboli Gardens, the Straw Market, the Church of Santa Croce, Orsanmichele Church, Piazza Signoria and the imposing Palazzo Vecchio. Among the monuments, not to be missed, located just outside the city center within walking distance or by public transport, there is the Church of San Miniato al Monte, from which you can also enjoy the most spectacular panoramic view of the city.The center of Florence is an open-air museum: discover it walking in complete freedom, accompanied by the audio commentary of your personal guide!Enrich your experience with a delicious Tuscan Lunch with Drinks in a historic Restaurant in the old town!
highlights: Independent visit of the city, without waste of time
A lot of time to take pictures, have shopping and lunch
Exhaustive itinerary touching all the not-to-be-missed monuments of Florence
Informative and reliable information provided by local guides
included: 1 Audiopen Device Rental (at disposal until 7.15pm of the reserved day from Mon-Sat, and until 4.30pm on Sundays)
1 encode interactive map per person (the map will remain to the customers as a souvenir)

data.title: Florence Duomo express guided tour
data.description: Book your Florence Duomo express guided tour with Musement. The iconic Florence Duomo minus the crowds with our no wait access and visit the spectacular Duomo, an architectural masterpiece
data.about: Steer clear of the astonishingly long queues and take advantage of privileged access to the majestic Florence Duomo, the third largest church in the world and an architectural masterpiece symbol of the city, with its beautiful colourful marbles and their mesmerizing geometric patterns. This incredible feat of engineering required a whole new process for its construction, which your guide will describe when you view it from inside and out. Brunelleschi's innovative approach involved vaulting the dome space without any scaffolding as he used a double shell with a space in between. Inside, the Duomo is no less impressive, with elaborate marble floors mirroring its exterior and beautiful frescos lining the dome, made by Vasari, namely the Last Judgement.Don’t miss the chance to learn all about it on this guided tour with exclusive access!
data.meeting_point: Cathedral in Piazza di San Giovanni, 7, just in front of the entrance to the Duomo tickets office. Look for a representative holding a ‘Florence Duomo Guided Tour – City Wonders & Senza Confini’ sign.
highlights: Discover the iconic Florence Duomo minus the crowds with no-wait-access
Visit an architectural masterpiece, crowned by the Brunelleschi’s dome and embellished with frescos by Vasari
Enjoy a 30 minute guided tour in English with an expert local guide
included: No wait access to Duomo Florence Cathedral
30 minutes guided tour with an expert, English-speaking local guide
Headsets when appropriate, so you don’t miss a word

data.title: Tickets to Pitti Palace and its museums
data.description: Buy your tickets for the Palazzo Pitti museums: Palatina Gallery and the Modern Art Gallery, Florence. Admire Italian art from the 18th century to World War I.
data.about:
Palazzo Pitti is one of Florence’s biggest museum. It is a powerful looking,13th century building that holds 5 museums within its halls and is directly connected to the beautiful Boboli Gardens. This ticket includes dedicated entrance to four of the main museums within the palace: 
- Galleria Palatina
- Gallery of Modern Art
- Museum of Fashion and Costume
- Treasure of the Grand Dukes
Galleria PalatinaThe Galleria Palatina, along with the building’s Royal Apartments, takes up all of the ‘piano nobile’ or left-wing of the Palace. The de’ Medici family that used this building as their residence, having moved out of Palazzo Vecchio and seat of the government, were great patrons of the arts. The most important paintings they collected over generations were hung in the Galleria Palatina. The paintings cover the walls of the 17th century rooms as their rich frames sat on top of the fresco decorations of the six rooms, overlooking the square in front of the Palace. Names of great artists such as Raphael, Titian, Correggio, Rubens, Pietro da Cortona are found here, along with other famous artists of the Renaissance and Baroque periods. A visit to the Palatine Gallery (Galleria Palatina) includes the visit of the 14 rooms that belong to the Royal Apartments.Gallery of Modern ArtThe Gallery of Modern Art is to be found on Palazzo Pitti’s second floor and is dedicated to Italian art that comes from the 18th century all the way up to World War I. The beautiful rooms of the Palace that now belong to the Gallery were once the residence of Lorraine Grand Dukes and are decorated in neoclassical and romantic works of art. Another feature of this Gallery is the section dedicated to artists of the Macchiaioli movement of the 19th and 20th centuries.Museum of Fashion and CostumeThis costume gallery is a true antique museum of fashion with nearly 600 gowns and dresses that show Florentine fashion and its development over the centuries.Treasure of the Grand DukesHolding a good portion of the treasure that once belonged to the de’ Medici family, this museum fascinates visitors with vases, gold work, precious stones and more.
highlights: Visit Palazzo Pitti, one of the Florence’s biggest museums
Explore four museums within the palace, including the Galleria Palatina and that of Modern Art
Admire Italian art from the 18th century to World War I
Discover the Galleria Palatina, used by de’ Medici family as a residence
